titles.title: Trade Transparency Act of 2015
A bill to require the President to make the text of trade agreements available to the public in order for those agreements to receive expedited consideration from Congress.
Trade Transparency Act of 2015

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

term.name: Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents

bill.summary:
Trade Transparency Act of 2015
This bill declares that expedited congressional procedures for consideration (fast track for approval) of implementing bills for trade agreements shall not apply to such bills unless the President makes available to the public the scrubbed bracketed text of the trade agreement at least 60 days before enactment of an Act giving the President trade promotion authority.
